name: Kepler-229
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-229 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-229 is a star with 0.625 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.73 times its radius. It is located 2758.89 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-229 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-229 b

Kepler-229 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.06 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 6.25 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-229.

The mass of Kepler-229 b is 6.36 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-229 b is 2.2 that of Earth. At 6.36 Earth masses, Kepler-229 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-229 c

Kepler-229 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.12 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 16.07 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-229.

The mass of Kepler-229 c is 44.06 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-229 c is 4.92 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-229 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.

Kepler-229 d

Kepler-229 d was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.22 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 41.19 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-229.

The mass of Kepler-229 d is 24.37 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-229 d is 3.85 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-229 d is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-229, which contains 3 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
